title: 10 friends – including Jesse Itzler – are riding 3,000 miles across America to donate bikes to youth
content:
Later this month, a group of ten including Jesse Itzler will spend two weeks biking from San Diego, California to St. Augustine, Florida. The journey covers 3,000 miles, meaning Itzler and his friends will need to average 214 miles a day relay style to get to Florida in time.

The group has a goal of raising enough money to provide one bike and helmet per mile ridden for disadvantaged kids. One per mile means a goal of providing 3,000 bikes and helmets to Title 1 underserved third graders.

Of course, this is done through a fundraiser partnered with the Bikes for Kids Foundation. Together, they claim that a donation of $135 is enough for a child to receive their own bike and helmet.

The two-week ride across the United States starts on April 24th. Follow along on Instagram at @jesseitzler. To learn more and donate to their cause, visit bikesforkidsfoundation.org.
author: Alvin Holbrook
